Apache Syncope artifacts are distributed in source and binary form under the terms of the + Apache License, Version 2.0. + See the included LICENSE and NOTICE files included in each artifact for additional license + information. +

+

Use the links below to download a source distribution of Apache Syncope. + It is good practice to verify the integrity of the distribution files.

+

Note that the preferred way to create an Apache Syncope project is to + generate a Maven + project starting from published archetype.

+
+ +
+ + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + +
ArtifactSignatures
+ syncope-root-1.0.0-RC1-incubating-source.tar.gz + + asc + md5 + sha1 +
+ syncope-root-1.0.0-RC1-incubating-source.zip + + asc + md5 + sha1 +
+ +
+ +
+
+ +
+

We strongly recommend you verify the integrity of the downloaded files with both PGP and MD5.

+ +

The PGP signatures can be verified using PGP or + GPG. + First download the KEYS as well as the + *.asc signature file for the particular distribution. Make sure you get these files from the main + distribution directory, rather than from a mirror. Then verify the signatures using one of the following sets of + commands: + + $ pgpk -a KEYS +$ pgpv syncope-*.tar.gz.asc +$ pgpv syncope-*.zip.asc + + $ pgp -ka KEYS +$ pgp syncope-*.tar.gz.asc +$ pgp syncope-*.zip.asc + + $ gpg --import KEYS +$ gpg --verify syncope-*.tar.gz.asc +$ gpg --verify syncope-*.zip.asc +

+

Alternatively, you can verify the MD5 signature on the files. A Unix/Linux program called + md5 or + md5sum is included in most distributions. It is also available as part of + GNU Textutils. + Windows users can get binary md5 programs from these (and likely other) places: +

    +
  • + http://www.md5summer.org/ +
    • +
  • + http://www.fourmilab.ch/md5/ +
    • +
  • + http://www.pc-tools.net/win32/md5sums/ +
    • +
